Anita

Get Outlook for iOS

HI Stella,

We have cleared the site cache. Let me know if this works for you?
https://www.stellainsurance.com.au/quick-quote/

Hi Joel,

We've just noticed on the live site that the predictive test in the address look up is not working. Are you able to investigate this please?

Thanks
Anita

Get Outlook for iOS

Hi Anita,

Confirming we have updated the live site. 
Have a great weekend as well. Cheers!

Hi Joel,

Thanks - that's been checked and it's approved.
Happy to push that live.

Thanks and have a lovely weekend.

Best wishes,
Anita

Get Outlook for iOS

Hi Anita,

We have made some changes on the staging site. https://staging-stellainsurance.kinsta.cloud/quick-quote/
The address field now Sends a request 300 ms after the last keystroke.

Let me know if this works for you? and if you are ok for us to push this to live.

action.text: Joel Maligalig assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,


Hope you're well.


Please see below - we are having some issues with our address look up and need to make a minor adjustment on the quick quote to help fix this. David has included some documentation to help resolve the issue (see below) can you please review and come back to me if this can be done?


Thanks

Anita


Anita Manchester

Head of Marketing


m 0404 968 482

w stellainsurance.com.au


From: Renee Cosgrave <Renee.Cosgrave@stellainsurance.com.au>
Sent: Friday, 25 February 2022 1:56 PM
To: Anita Manchester <anita.manchester@stellainsurance.com.au>
Subject: FW: [Aventus Platform] Re: Update of customer addresses


Hi Anita,


Can you please provide to WP Perk for the address look up on the website and let us know when this has been actioned so I can let Aventus know.


Thanks,
Renee


From: David Barnes (Support - Aventus Platform) <support@aventusplatform.com>
Sent: Friday, 25 February 2022 4:50 AM
To: Renee Cosgrave <renee.cosgrave@stellainsurance.com.au>
Cc: David Barnes <david@aventusplatform.com>; Aventus On Call Team <mike@aventusplatform.com>; Stephen.Lau <stephen.lau@finity.com.au>; Jess Qi <jess.qi@finity.com.au>
Subject: [Aventus Platform] Re: Update of customer addresses


##- Please type your reply above this line -##

Your request (734) has been updated. To add additional comments, reply to this email.

David Barnes (Aventus Platform)

24 Feb 2022, 17:50 GMT

Hi Renee, Stephen,

The team have looked into this and there are two areas that this behaviour will need to be updated.

1 - Address look up on Symphony / Opus (via Salesforce)
2 - Address look up on Stella Website (Quick Quote)

With regards to the address look up on the Symphony / Opus (via Salesforce), we are going to be changing the behaviour for the time delay after the last keystroke and also add a delay to our retry, if we receive a failed response.

The changes we are making are detailed below.

Current behaviour - Symphony / Opus (via Salesforce)

· Sends a request 100ms after the last keystroke (resetting for every keystroke)

· If it receives a failed response, it will retry using exponential backoff, trying the first retry immediately, then 400ms later, then 800ms later, then 1600ms after that


To be behaviour - Symphony / Opus (via Salesforce)

· Sends a request 250 ms after the last keystroke (resetting for every keystroke)

· If it receives a failed response, it will retry using exponential backoff, trying the first retry after 100ms, then 400ms later, then 800ms later, then 1600ms after that


This change will be made over the next few days.

With regards to Address look up on Stella Website (Quick Quote) we have updated the documentation for this integration to include the recommendation to throttle requests from Jess and the team at Finity.

As this code is written/managed by Stella's developers (WP Perk) they would need to add the throttling behaviour on the Stella website, in order to update the Quick Quote experience. Renee could you forward this documentation (and I imagine this thread) to the team at WP Perk and let us know if they have any questions.

We will let you know when our work has been completed on Symphony / Opus.

Thanks,

David


Renee Cosgrave

24 Feb 2022, 11:24 GMT

As for the below customer, I did email him to let him know he could use the manual search and unfortunately, I couldn't find a quote attached to his email address so thinking he may have only done a quick quote. I was hoping Aventus may have been able to find this.


@mike@aventusplatform.com and @David Barnes - Aventus based on this does the Aventus team have everything they need to move forward and resolve the issue we're having?


Thanks, Renee

Stephen Lau

24 Feb 2022, 11:10 GMT

Hi Renee,

Just to clarify, what Jess is suggesting is that instead of immediately pinging Finaddress to update the dropdown list on each keystroke, Aventus should just ping Finaddress whenever the user pauses typing slightly - they don't need to key in the full address for the dropdown to appear. As an example shown below (and you can test this here), it can be configured so that you can still key in a partial address string and pause slightly, and the dropdown will be displayed (ie. it is still predictive). Aventus should be able to define the how long this 'pause' is detected in the JavaScript code before pinging Finaddress.

As Jess noted below, it seems to be only impacting a very small number of customers at the moment, and the majority are getting back addresses search results fine.

By the way, for your third customer:

Hanadi Sultan - hanadibeik@hotmail.com - date of request 17 February 2022

o This is a quote and customer wrote to us saying the following: Message: hi when i write my address it show cant find my address what should i do

Do you know what the address they are trying to enter is? They could also use the manual entry form if they really can't find their address for whatever reason:

Regards

Stephen Lau

Ph. + 61 2 8252 3494

Mobile. +61 414 729 887

Email. stephen.lau@finity.com.au

From: Renee Cosgrave <renee.cosgrave@stellainsurance.com.au>
Sent: Thursday, 24 February 2022 9:52 PM
To: Jess Qi <Jess.Qi@finity.com.au>; Support - Aventus Platform <support@aventusplatform.com>
Cc: Stephen Lau <Stephen.Lau@finity.com.au>
Subject: Re: [Aventus Platform] Re: Update of customer addresses

External Email: Please be cautious with links and attachments

Hi Everyone,

I really need a resolution on the address issues we're having. Especially for our existing customers that are currently impacted.

It's not desired to make the customer complete their full address in the search before it looks up the address, predictive/suggested search is my preferred look up method, but if that's the only way we can get a resolution quickly then this is what we need to do.


Thanks,

Renee

Jess Qi

24 Feb 2022, 08:27 GMT

Hi Everyone,

We do have log for successful API calls. I have attached a log file. Please be aware, the log file only record the successful address pick, once successful address pick may contains 5-15 API calls, this is according to Stella's current implementation.

From 16/01/2022, we have around 4K addresses been picked, estimate around 20K -60K API calls.

After investigating both of our log files, I still believe the quick API call caused issues. I recommend we get it fixed first.

Here are some details of my finding.

404 Resource be removed Error, we have 322 out of 1000 errors

I suspect it was the platform temporary blocked the API calls from Stella for a very short period of time.

For example:

We have this error between 01:20, 01:24

According to our log, Stella had successful address call on 1:12, 1:25, It doesn't look like the server was off line or had any issues.

I have double checked, during 1:20 and 1:24, Finaddress was operating normally and we were still getting successful API calls from all other clients.

Unfortunately, I cannot find any log in our system. I only can assume it was blocked by the platform.

500 InternalServerError, we have 304 records out of 1000

This error was generated by our system, it is caused by short burst of API calls and created some dead lock in system.

But this error will not impact the user experience, and end user should be able to pick the address successful. They shouldn't even notice it.

Usually, when you submit 10 API calls to Finaddress server, only one or two of them get this error. But Stella website only need one successful API call response to generate the list.

Here is two examples,

Here is the error from Stella Log.

We can find the client successful pick the address in our log, without any issue.

Even this error was not harmful, We are still trying our best to identifying and fixing this issue.

If Stella can update the API call only happens when client stop typing, this issue should be fixed.

I don't believe this issue is the root cause we have.

I hope have explained my finding well. Let me know if you have any further questions.

Thanks.

Regards

Jess Qi

Ph. +61 3 8080 0918

Mobile. +61 433 782 082

Email. jess.qi@finity.com.au

At Finity we work flexibly. I am sending this message now because it suits my working hours.

I do not expect that you will read, respond to or action this message outside of your usual hours unless expressly requested.

Attachment(s)
Stella Address Search Log.xlsx


Aventus On Call Team (Aventus Platform)

24 Feb 2022, 06:57 GMT

Evening Stephen, Jess.

Please find attached logs from our system for the last 1000 failed requests to finaddress. Please note that at this time, due to volume, we are only logging failed requests to FinAddress. I have also stripped the request headers from this payload as that only had our request token.

You can see that there can be various times of unavailability; and there is a large mixture of responses when things are not working/not available.

For the addresses in question no error was logged, so I can only assume we received a valid response with empty or otherwise data.

Does Finaddress log successful calls?

Cheers,

Mike Scott

Attachment(s)
2022-02-24_stella_apilog_finaddress_1000.xlsx

David Barnes (Aventus Platform)

23 Feb 2022, 17:46 GMT

Hi Renee, Stephen,

We can confirm that we start to call the API for results after the first three characters have been entered and thereafter we call the API after each keystoke. Our developers didn't see anything in the implementation guide re number of API calls, so kept the behaviour as it was with Experian.

To be sure that it is the Firewall blocking this as a DoS attack, Stephen are you able to see the Firewall logs with these attempts getting blocked?

If this is the case, Renee are you comfortable with the change of UX, so the address will start to be suggested once the customer stops typing as seen here - https://www.finaddress.com.au

Thanks,

David


Stephen Lau

23 Feb 2022, 06:22 GMT

In addition to my email below, our Finaddress developer has done some initial investigations (See attached email for more details):

  • It seems the Auto G-NAF function is being used, which means the latest G-NAF version is being ingested, so this G-NAF versioning is not an issue.
  • He suspected that the Finaddress API is being called as each keystroke is being entered by the user. This could trigger our firewall to think it is a suspected DoS attack and block the request.
    • He provided a sample JavaScript fix to only call Finaddress when the user stops typing.

Hope this helps with your investigation.

Regards

Stephen Lau

Ph. + 61 2 8252 3494

Mobile. +61 414 729 887

Email. stephen.lau@finity.com.au

Sent: Wednesday, 23 February 2022 3:51 PM

Hi Support team,

Over the past week I have seen 3 separate customers contact us regarding not being able to find their address or update their address in the quote journey. Can you please advise if something has change or why we are suddenly seeing this as an issue. Below are the 3 separate cases:

  1. Abigail Thomas - Policy STEMC11679 - date of request 10 February 2022 (I believe this has been escalated to support twice by Linda already)

o Address being updated from 4/129 Trafalgar Street, Stanmore NSW 2048 to the new address of unit 46 5-11 Pyrmont Bridge road, Camperdown NSW 2050

  1. Matthew Ross - Policy STEMC12411 - date of request 15 February 2022

o Address being updated from 6 Byron Avenue, Newport QLD 4020 to the new address of 33 Astley Parade North Lakes QLD 4509

  1. Hanadi Sultan - hanadibeik@hotmail.com - date of request 17 February 2022

o This is a quote and customer wrote to us saying the following: Message: hi when i write my address it show cant find my address what should i do

I have included Stephen from Finity on this support request as Stephen is the business owner of Finaddress at Finity and may be able to provide some insight if there has been any update from Finity's side.

Thanks,
Renee

Renee Cosgrave

General Manager


m 0421 589 062

w stellainsurance.com.au
